cocinas.descripcionLarga: A family space where tradition meets the warmth of home. For three generations we have preserved the authentic flavors of our land, offering a culinary experience that transcends the simple act of eating to become an encounter with our roots.
cocinas.descripcionAmbiente: Warm and cozy atmosphere that evokes grandmother's kitchen, with rustic wooden furniture, clay pots and the unmistakable aroma of roasted spices. Every corner tells a story of family and tradition.

historia.titulo: Three generations of love in every dish
historia.contenido: Since 1985, our stove has never been turned off. My grandmother María started this legacy when she decided that the flavors of our land deserved to be preserved. She began selling tamales in the local market, and little by little, her unique seasoning conquered the palates of all San Juan Tahitic. Today, my daughters continue the tradition, mixing ancestral techniques with a contemporary touch that keeps our heritage alive.
historia.fraseEmblematica: Here we don't cook in a hurry, we cook with memory

imagenes.descripcion: Wrapped in corn husks with regional herbs
Slow cooking for 8 hours in earth pit
Traditional decoration for the patron saint festival
Local herbs and spices carefully chosen

especialidades.descripcion: Prepared with 12 wood-fired roasted chilies and metate chocolate. Family recipe dating back to 1890, passed down through 4 generations. Each ingredient is manually selected to guarantee authenticity.
especialidades.historia: This recipe was created by my great-grandmother Elena in 1890 to celebrate community weddings. Originally prepared only for special occasions, today we share it with all our visitors.
especialidades.recomendacion: Our most requested dish. Ideal for sharing with family.

especialidades.descripcion: Nixtamalized masa filled with black beans and wrapped in corn husks with regional herbs. Soft texture and unique aroma that evokes traditional breakfasts.
especialidades.historia: Pre-Hispanic dish that community women prepared for work days in the fields. Today it maintains its nutritious and delicious essence.
especialidades.recomendacion: Perfect for breakfast, accompanied by atole.

especialidades.descripcion: Beef slowly cooked in earth pit for 8 hours. Juicy, tender and with that unmistakable smoky flavor that only ancestral cooking can provide.
especialidades.historia: Adapted pre-Hispanic technique that Don Elena perfected after years of experimentation. The maguey provides a unique flavor not achieved with other methods.
especialidades.recomendacion: Only available on weekends. Reservation recommended.

especialidades.descripcion: Hot drink prepared with ground white corn, cinnamon and piloncillo. Creamy consistency and aroma that comforts the soul on cold mornings.
especialidades.historia: Drink that accompanied children on their way to school. Today it remains the preferred breakfast of our Tahitic mornings.
especialidades.recomendacion: Ideal for cold mornings in the region.

experiencia.momentoIdeal: Midday, when the sun bathes the dining room

ubicacion.direccion: Knowledge Street #15, San Juan Tahitic, Oaxaca
ubicacion.instrucciones: 5 minutes walking from the main square. The house has a yellow facade with flower pots.

recomendaciones: Try our ancestral mole, it's our pride
Visit us with family, we have space for groups

cocinas.descripcionLarga: A culinary sanctuary where pre-Hispanic techniques remain alive. Under the shade of the centennial ahuehuete, Don José shares the ancestral knowledge of stone broth, offering an experience that connects diners with the deepest roots of our gastronomy.
cocinas.descripcionAmbiente: Rustic outdoor space with log tables and stone hearths. The sound of nearby river water and the crackling of firewood create a magical atmosphere that transports to ancestral times.

historia.contenido: Don José, at 78 years old, keeps alive the pre-Hispanic technique of stone broth. Every morning he selects the volcanic stones that will flavor his broths. He learned this art from his grandfather, who in turn inherited it from previous generations. Today, he is one of the last guardians of this tradition in the entire state of Oaxaca.
historia.fraseEmblematica: Our ingredients are love letters to the land

imagenes.descripcion: Cacahuazintle corn and local farm pork
Traditional process to choose the best stones
Collection of plants for infusions and dishes
Where we grow our medicinal plants

especialidades.descripcion: Cooked with red-hot volcanic stones in traditional style. Ancestral technique that imparts a unique mineral flavor and preserves all the nutrients of the ingredients. Complete sensory experience.
especialidades.historia: Pre-Hispanic technique that ancestors used to cook without metal utensils. Don José is one of the last guardians of this knowledge in the region. Each stone is selected for its unique mineral composition.
especialidades.recomendacion: Experience the complete experience with the cooking demonstration.

especialidades.descripcion: Cacahuazintle corn and local farm pork slowly cooked. Robust flavor and textures that celebrate authentic Mexican cuisine. Perfect balance of spices and tradition.
especialidades.historia: Festive dish that was served at important town celebrations. Today it is our emblem of hospitality and community.
especialidades.recomendacion: Ideal for sharing. Serve with tostadas and cream.

especialidades.descripcion: Ancestral drink prepared with ground corn, cinnamon and local bee honey. Naturally sweetened with regional honey for an authentic and comforting flavor.
especialidades.historia: Recipe that Don José's grandmother created for the town's children. Honey replaced the original piloncillo, creating a unique version of the traditional drink.
especialidades.recomendacion: Perfect to start the day with energy.

especialidades.descripcion: Large corn tortilla toasted with pork asiento, beans and quesillo. Crispy outside, soft inside with the essential flavors of Oaxaca adapted to local ingredients.
especialidades.historia: Adaptation of the Oaxacan tlayuda that Don José learned on his travels. He combined traditional techniques with local ingredients, creating a unique version.
especialidades.recomendacion: Our quick but equally delicious version.

experiencia.momentoIdeal: Sunset, when golden light enters through the window

ubicacion.direccion: Tradition Square, San Juan Tahitic, Oaxaca
ubicacion.instrucciones: In the heart of the main square, under the millennial tree. The hearth smoke can be seen from afar.

recomendaciones: Come with time to enjoy the complete experience
Ask for the stone broth demonstration
Perfect for culture and tradition lovers
